channel.title: Questions about vps!
channel.description:
[B]if i brought a vps do i need to download anything that's on it? or can i just put the files onto the site and shit?
what is a good and afforadble vps company?
can a vps be brought with a walmart paypal cart?
thanks-[/B]

item.title: Questions about vps!
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

[quote=“Army123, post:4, topic:437250”][quote author=Skiire link=topic=539962.msg3953434#msg3953434 date=1332514259]

[B]if i brought a vps do i need to download anything that’s on it? or can i just put the files onto the site and shit?

what is a good and afforadble vps company?

can a vps be brought with a walmart paypal cart?

thanks-[/B]

I’m not quite sure I understood your first question, so if I don’t accurately answer it, my apologies. Nonetheless, from what I understood, yes you’ll need to download the essentials. It’s a bare-boned virtual server. Java, UI (unless you’re okay with shell commands), and various other programs may need to be installed as well as the server you’re hosting on it.

Completely opinionated. I used MyHosting quite a while back though, I loved them. They had a wonderful 24/7, free troubleshoot hotline that came in handy when I was doing DDoS’d.

I believe a Walmart Cart can only be used on Walmart.com. If so, no. If not, then possibly.
[/quote]

umm would the program be able to instal without admin permisson?
because my dad has admin program on my comp, and i cant dl for shit

and i meant paypal card brought from walmart[/quote]

Those programs would be installed on the VPS, not your home computer. The only thing that you would be installing on your home computer you would just have to have a terminal to access the VPS. So, yes you would have to have Administrative rights on your computer. Unless you’re buying a pricier VPS which might have different alternatives (I went with the basics).

Yes, you can purchase a VPS with PayPal. However, it’s a recurring monthly payment, so that might become tedious.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“Army123, post:1, topic:437250”][B]if i brought a vps do i need to download anything that’s on it? or can i just put the files onto the site and shit?

what is a good and afforadble vps company?

can a vps be brought with a walmart paypal cart?

thanks-[/B][/quote]

I’m not quite sure I understood your first question, so if I don’t accurately answer it, my apologies. Nonetheless, from what I understood, yes you’ll need to download the essentials. It’s a bare-boned virtual server. Java, UI (unless you’re okay with shell commands), and various other programs may need to be installed as well as the server you’re hosting on it.

Completely opinionated. I used MyHosting quite a while back though, I loved them. They had a wonderful 24/7, free troubleshoot hotline that came in handy when I was doing DDoS’d.

I believe a Walmart Cart can only be used on Walmart.com. If so, no. If not, then possibly.

item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Think of it this way: It’s a new computer that’s hosted somewhere in the world and (hopefully) 24/7.
